name: stationAdded
description: Subscription for a new station was added in the system event

fields.name: review
fields.description: Review of a station

children.name: rating
children.description: Average of all reviews

children.name: count
children.description: 'Total number of reviews

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID of a station

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of a station

fields.name: party_id
fields.description: CPO ID of a CPO that 'owns' this station (following the ISO-15118 standard)

fields.name: publish
fields.description:
Defines if a Location may be published on an website or app etc.
When this is set to false, only tokens identified in the field: publish_allowed_to are allowed to show this Location.
When the same location has EVSEs that may be published and may not be published, two 'Locations' should be created.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of a charging station

fields.name: address
fields.description: Street/block name and house number if available

fields.name: city
fields.description: City or town

fields.name: postal_code
fields.description: Postal code of a location, may only be omitted when a location has no postal code: in some countries charging locations at highways don’t have postal codes.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State or province of a location, only to be used when relevant

fields.name: country
fields.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code for the country of this station

fields.name: coordinates
fields.description: Coordinates of a location

children.name: latitude
children.description: Latitude of the point in decimal degree. Example: 50.770774. Decimal separator: "." Regex: -?[0-9]{1,2}\.[0-9]{5,7}

children.name: longitude
children.description: Longitude of the point in decimal degree. Example: -126.104965. Decimal separator: "." Regex: -?[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{5,7}

fields.name: related_locations
fields.description: Geographical location of related points relevant to a user

children.name: latitude
children.description: Latitude of the point in decimal degree. Example: 50.770774. Decimal separator: "." Regex: -?[0-9]{1,2}\.[0-9]{5,7}

children.name: longitude
children.description: Longitude of the point in decimal degree. Example: -126.104965. Decimal separator: "." Regex: -?[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{5,7}

children.name: name
children.description: Name of the point in local language or as written at the location. For example the street name of a parking lot entrance or it’s number.

children.name: language
children.description: Language Code ISO 639-1

children.name: text
children.description: Text to be displayed to an end user. No markup, html etc. allowed.

fields.name: parking_type
fields.description: Type of parking at a charge point location

children.name: ALONG_MOTORWAY
children.description: Location on a parking facility/rest area along a motorway, freeway, interstate, highway etc.

children.name: PARKING_GARAGE
children.description: Multistorey car park.

children.name: PARKING_LOT
children.description: A cleared area that is intended for parking vehicles, i.e. at supermarkets, bars, etc.

children.name: ON_DRIVEWAY
children.description: Location is on the driveway of a house/building.

children.name: ON_STREET
children.description: Parking in public space along a street.

children.name: UNDERGROUND_GARAGE
children.description: Multistorey car park, mainly underground.

fields.name: evses
fields.description: EVSEs that belong to a station

children.name: uid
children.description:
Uniquely identifies an EVSE within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms). For example a database ID or the actual "EVSE ID". This field can never be changed, modified or renamed. This is the 'technical' identification of the EVSE, not to be used as 'human readable' identification, use the field evse_id for that.
This field is named uid instead of id, because id could be confused with evse_id which is an eMI3 defined field.

children.name: evse_id
children.description: Compliant with the following specification for EVSE ID from "eMI3 standard version V1.0" (http://emi3group.com/documents-links/) "Part 2: business objects." Optional because: if an evse_id is to be re-used in the real world, the evse_id can be removed from an EVSE object if the status is set to REMOVED.

children.name: status
children.description: Indicates the current status of an EVSE.

children.name: AVAILABLE
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is able to start a new charging session.

children.name: BLOCKED
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is not accessible because of a physical barrier, i.e. a car.

children.name: CHARGING
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is in use.

children.name: INOPERATIVE
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is not yet active or it is no longer available (deleted).

children.name: OUTOFORDER
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is currently out of order.

children.name: PLANNED
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is planned, will be operating soon.

children.name: REMOVED
children.description: The EVSE/Connector was discontinued/removed.

children.name: RESERVED
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is reserved for a particular EV driver and is unavailable for other drivers.

children.name: UNKNOWN
children.description: No status information available (also used when offline).

children.name: status_schedule
children.description: Indicates a planned status update of a nEVSE.

children.name: period_begin
children.description: Begin of the scheduled period.

children.name: period_end
children.description: End of the scheduled period, if known.

children.name: status
children.description: Status value during the scheduled period.

children.name: AVAILABLE
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is able to start a new charging session.

children.name: BLOCKED
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is not accessible because of a physical barrier, i.e. a car.

children.name: CHARGING
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is in use.

children.name: INOPERATIVE
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is not yet active or it is no longer available (deleted).

children.name: OUTOFORDER
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is currently out of order.

children.name: PLANNED
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is planned, will be operating soon.

children.name: REMOVED
children.description: The EVSE/Connector was discontinued/removed.

children.name: RESERVED
children.description: The EVSE/Connector is reserved for a particular EV driver and is unavailable for other drivers.

children.name: UNKNOWN
children.description: No status information available (also used when offline).

children.name: capabilities
children.description: List of functionalities that an EVSE is capable of.

children.name: CHARGING_PROFILE_CAPABLE
children.description: The EVSE supports charging profiles.

children.name: CHARGING_PREFERENCES_CAPABLE
children.description: The EVSE supports charging preferences.

children.name: CHIP_CARD_SUPPORT
children.description: EVSE has a payment terminal that supports chip cards.

children.name: CONTACTLESS_CARD_SUPPORT
children.description: EVSE has a payment terminal that supports contactless cards.

children.name: CREDIT_CARD_PAYABLE
children.description: EVSE has a payment terminal that makes it possible to pay for charging using a credit card.

children.name: DEBIT_CARD_PAYABLE
children.description: EVSE has a payment terminal that makes it possible to pay for charging using a debit card.

children.name: PED_TERMINAL
children.description: EVSE has a payment terminal with a pin-code entry device.

children.name: REMOTE_START_STOP_CAPABLE
children.description: The EVSE can remotely be started/stopped.

children.name: RESERVABLE
children.description: The EVSE can be reserved.

children.name: RFID_READER
children.description: Charging at this EVSE can be authorized with an RFID token.

children.name: TOKEN_GROUP_CAPABLE
children.description: This EVSE supports token groups, two or more tokens work as one, so that a session can be started with one token and stopped with another (handy when a card and key-fob are given to the EV-driver).

children.name: UNLOCK_CAPABLE
children.description: Connectors have a mechanical lock that can be requested by the eMSP to be unlocked.

children.name: connectors
children.description: List of available connectors on an EVSE.

children.name: id
children.description: Identifier of a connector within an EVSE. Two connectors may have the same ID as long as they do not belong to the same EVSE object.

children.name: standard
children.description: Standard of an installed connector.

children.name: CHADEMO
children.description: The connector type is CHAdeMO, DC

children.name: DOMESTIC_A
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "A", NEMA 1-15, 2 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_B
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "B", NEMA 5-15, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_C
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "C", CEE 7/17, 2 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_D
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "D", 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_E
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "E", CEE 7/5 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_F
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "F", CEE 7/4, Schuko, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_G
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "G", BS 1363, Commonwealth, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_H
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "H", SI-32, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_I
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "I", AS 3112, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_J
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "J", SEV 1011, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_K
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "K", DS 60884-2-D1, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_L
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "L", CEI 23-16-VII, 3 pins

children.name: IEC_60309_2_single_16
children.description: IEC 60309-2 Industrial Connector single phase 16 amperes (usually blue)

children.name: IEC_60309_2_three_16
children.description: IEC 60309-2 Industrial Connector three phase 16 amperes (usually red)

children.name: IEC_60309_2_three_32
children.description: IEC 60309-2 Industrial Connector three phase 32 amperes (usually red)

children.name: IEC_60309_2_three_64
children.description: IEC 60309-2 Industrial Connector three phase 64 amperes (usually red)

children.name: IEC_62196_T1
children.description: IEC 62196 Type 1 "SAE J1772"

children.name: IEC_62196_T1_COMBO
children.description: Combo Type 1 based, DC

children.name: IEC_62196_T2
children.description: IEC 62196 Type 2 "Mennekes"

children.name: IEC_62196_T2_COMBO
children.description: Combo Type 2 based, DC

children.name: IEC_62196_T3A
children.description: IEC 62196 Type 3A

children.name: IEC_62196_T3C
children.description: IEC 62196 Type 3C "Scame"

children.name: PANTOGRAPH_BOTTOM_UP
children.description: On-board Bottom-up-Pantograph typically for bus charging

children.name: PANTOGRAPH_TOP_DOWN
children.description: Off-board Top-down-Pantograph typically for bus charging

children.name: TESLA_R
children.description: Tesla Connector "Roadster"-type (round, 4 pins)

children.name: TESLA_S
children.description: Tesla Connector "Model-S"-type (oval, 5 pins)

children.name: format
children.description: Format (socket/cable) of an installed connector.

children.name: SOCKET
children.description: The connector is a socket; the EV user needs to bring a fitting plug.

children.name: CABLE
children.description: The connector is an attached cable; the EV users car needs to have a fitting inlet.

children.name: power_type
children.description: Type of power of an installed connector.

children.name: AC_1_PHASE
children.description: AC single phase.

children.name: AC_3_PHASE
children.description: AC three phase.

children.name: DC
children.description: Direct Current.

children.name: max_voltage
children.description: Maximum voltage of an connector (line to neutral for AC_3_PHASE), in volt [V]. For example: DC Chargers might vary the voltage during charging when battery almost full.

children.name: max_amperage
children.description: Maximum amperage of a connector, in ampere [A].

children.name: max_electric_power
children.description:
Maximum electric power that can be delivered by a connector, in watt [W]. When the maximum electric power is lower than the calculated value from voltage and amperage, this value should be set.
For example: A DC Charge Point which can deliver up to 920V and up to 400A can be limited to a maximum of 150kW. Depending on the car, it may supply maximum voltage or current, but not both at the same time.
For AC Charge Points, the amount of phases used can also have influence on the maximum power.

children.name: power
children.description: Maximum electric power in kW

children.name: tariff_ids
children.description:
Identifiers of the currently valid charging tariffs. Multiple tariffs are possible, but only one of each Tariff.type can be active at the same time. Tariffs with the same type are only allowed, if they are not active at the same time: start_date_time and end_date_time period not overlapping.
When preference-based smart charging is supported, one tariff for every possible ProfileType should be provided. This tells the user about the options they have at this Connector, and what the tariff is for every option.
For a "free of charge" tariff, this field should be set and point to a defined "free of charge" tariff.

children.name: terms_and_conditions
children.description: URL to an operator’s terms and conditions.

children.name: last_updated
children.description: Timestamp when a connector was last updated (or created).

children.name: properties
children.description: Optional object where you can store custom data you need in your application. This extends the current functionalities we offer

children.name: tariff
children.description: List of valid charging tariffs

children.name: country_code
children.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the CPO that owns this Tariff.

children.name: party_id
children.description: CPO ID of the CPO that owns this Tariff (following the ISO-15118 standard).

children.name: id
children.description: Uniquely identifies the tariff within the CPO’s platform (and suboperator platforms).

children.name: currency
children.description: ISO-4217 code of the currency of this tariff.

children.name: type
children.description: Defines the type of the tariff. This allows for distinction in case of given Charging Preferences. When omitted, this tariff is valid for all sessions.

children.name: AD_HOC_PAYMENT
children.description: Used to describe that a Tariff is valid when ad-hoc payment is used at the Charge Point (for example: Debit or Credit card payment terminal).

children.name: PROFILE_CHEAP
children.description: Used to describe that a Tariff is valid when Charging Preference: CHEAP is set for the session.

children.name: PROFILE_FAST
children.description: Used to describe that a Tariff is valid when Charging Preference: FAST is set for the session.

children.name: PROFILE_GREEN
children.description: Used to describe that a Tariff is valid when Charging Preference: GREEN is set for the session.

children.name: REGULAR
children.description: Used to describe that a Tariff is valid when using an RFID, without any Charging Preference, or when Charging Preference: REGULAR is set for the session.

children.name: tariff_alt_text
children.description: List of alternative tariff information texts, in multiple languages.

children.name: language
children.description: Language Code ISO 639-1

children.name: text
children.description: Text to be displayed to an end user. No markup, html etc. allowed.

children.name: tariff_alt_url
children.description: URL to a web page that contains an explanation of the tariff information in human readable form.

children.name: min_price
children.description: When this field is set, a Charging Session with this tariff will cost at least this amount. This is different from a FLAT fee (Start Tariff, Transaction Fee), as a FLAT fee is a fixed amount that has to be payed for any Charging Session. A minimum price indicates that when the cost of a Charging Session is lower than this amount, the cost of the Session will be equal to this amount. (Also see note below)

children.name: excl_vat
children.description: Price/Cost excluding VAT.

children.name: incl_vat
children.description: Price/Cost including VAT.

children.name: max_price
children.description: When this field is set, a Charging Session with this tariff will NOT cost more than this amount

children.name: excl_vat
children.description: Price/Cost excluding VAT.

children.name: incl_vat
children.description: Price/Cost including VAT.

children.name: elements
children.description: List of Tariff Elements.

children.name: price_components
children.description: List of price components that describe the pricing of a tariff.

children.name: type
children.description: Type of tariff dimension.

children.name: ENERGY
children.description: Defined in kWh, step_size multiplier: 1 Wh

children.name: FLAT
children.description: Flat fee without unit for step_size

children.name: PARKING_TIME
children.description: Time not charging: defined in hours, step_size multiplier: 1 second

children.name: TIME
children.description: Time charging: defined in hours, step_size multiplier: 1 second Can also be used in combination with a RESERVATION restriction to describe the price of the reservation time.

children.name: price
children.description: Price per unit (excl. VAT) for this tariff dimension.

children.name: vat
children.description: Applicable VAT percentage for this tariff dimension. If omitted, no VAT is applicable. Not providing a VAT is different from 0% VAT, which would be a value of 0.0 here.

children.name: step_size
children.description: Minimum amount to be billed. This unit will be billed in this step_size blocks. For example: if type is TIME and step_size has a value of 300, then time will be billed in blocks of 5 minutes. If 6 minutes were used, 10 minutes (2 blocks of step_size) will be billed.

children.name: restrictions
children.description: Restrictions that describe the applicability of a tariff.

children.name: start_time
children.description: Start time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 13:30, valid from this time of the day. Must be in 24h format with leading zeros. Hour/Minute separator: ":" Regex: ([0-1][0-9]|2[1-3]):[0-5][0-9]

children.name: end_time
children.description: End time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 19:45, valid until this time of the day. Same syntax as start_time.

children.name: start_date
children.description: Start date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example: 2015-12-24, valid from this day. Regex: ([12][0-9]{3})-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])

children.name: end_date
children.description: End date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example: 2015-12-27, valid until this day (exclusive). Same syntax as start_date.

children.name: min_kwh
children.description: Minimum consumed energy in kWh, for example 20, valid from this amount of energy being used.

children.name: max_kwh
children.description: Maximum consumed energy in kWh, for example 50, valid until this amount of energy being used.

children.name: min_current
children.description: Sum of the minimum current in A over all phases, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than the defined amount of current, this TariffElement is/becomes active. If the charging current is or becomes lower, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the minimum current over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging current is above the defined value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging current drops below the defined value.

children.name: max_current
children.description: Sum of the maximum current in A over all phases, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of current, this TariffElement becomes/is active. If the charging current is or becomes higher, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the maximum current over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging current is below this value, but the TariffElement MUST  no longer be active when the charging current raises above the defined value.

children.name: min_power
children.description: Minimum power in kW, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than the defined amount of power, this TariffElement is/becomes active. If the charging power is or becomes lower, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the minimum power over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging power is above this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power drops below the defined value.

children.name: max_power
children.description: Maximum power in kW, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of power, this TariffElement becomes/is active. If the charging power is or becomes higher, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the maximum power over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging power is below this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power raises above the defined value.

children.name: min_duration
children.description: Minimum duration in seconds the Charging Session MUST last (inclusive). When the duration of a Charging Session is longer than the defined value, this TariffElement is or becomes active. Before that moment, this TariffElement is not yet active.

children.name: max_duration
children.description: Maximum duration in seconds the Charging Session MUST last (exclusive). When the duration of a Charging Session is shorter than the defined value, this TariffElement is or becomes active. After that moment, this TariffElement is no longer active.

children.name: day_of_week
children.description: Which day(s) of the week this TariffElement is active.

children.name: reservation
children.description: When this field is present, the TariffElement describes reservation costs. A reservation starts when the reservation is made, and ends when the drivers starts charging on the reserved EVSE/Location, or when the reservation expires. A reservation can only have: FLAT and TIME TariffDimensions, where TIME is for the duration of the reservation.

children.name: RESERVATION
children.description: Used in TariffElements to describe costs for a reservation.

children.name: RESERVATION_EXPIRES
children.description: Used in TariffElements to describe costs for a reservation that expires (i.e. driver does not start a charging session before expiry_date of the reservation).

children.name: start_date_time
children.description: The time when this tariff becomes active, in UTC, time_zone field of the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used for a new tariff that is already given with the location, before it becomes active

children.name: end_date_time
children.description: The time after which this tariff is no longer valid, in UTC, time_zone field if the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used when this tariff is going to be replaced with a different tariff in the near future

children.name: energy_mix
children.description: Details about the energy supplied with this tariff.

children.name: is_green_energy
children.description: True if the power is 100% from regenerative sources

children.name: energy_sources
children.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of energy sources of this location’s tariff.

children.name: source
children.description: The type of energy source.

children.name: NUCLEAR
children.description: Nuclear power sources.

children.name: GENERAL_FOSSIL
children.description: All kinds of fossil power sources.

children.name: COAL
children.description: Fossil power from coal.

children.name: GAS
children.description: Fossil power from gas.

children.name: GENERAL_GREEN
children.description: All kinds of regenerative power sources.

children.name: SOLAR
children.description: Regenerative power from PV.

children.name: WIND
children.description: Regenerative power from wind turbines.

children.name: WATER
children.description: Regenerative power from water turbines.

children.name: percentage
children.description: Percentage of this source (0-100) in the mix.

children.name: environ_impact
children.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of nuclear waste and CO2 exhaust of this location’s tariff.

children.name: category
children.description: The environmental impact category of this value.

children.name: NUCLEAR_WASTE
children.description: Produced nuclear waste in grams per kilowatthour.

children.name: CARBON_DIOXIDE
children.description: Exhausted carbon dioxide in grams per kilowatthour.

children.name: amount
children.description: Amount of this portion in g/kWh.

children.name: supplier_name
children.description: Name of the energy supplier, delivering the energy for this location or tariff.*

children.name: energy_product_name
children.description: Name of the energy suppliers product/tariff plan used at this location.*

children.name: last_updated
children.description: Timestamp when this Tariff was last updated (or created).

children.name: floor_level
children.description: Level on which a Charge Point is located (in garage buildings) in the locally displayed numbering scheme.

children.name: coordinates
children.description: Coordinates of a EVSE.

children.name: latitude
children.description: Latitude of the point in decimal degree. Example: 50.770774. Decimal separator: "." Regex: -?[0-9]{1,2}\.[0-9]{5,7}

children.name: longitude
children.description: Longitude of the point in decimal degree. Example: -126.104965. Decimal separator: "." Regex: -?[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{5,7}

children.name: physical_reference
children.description: A number/string printed on the outside of an EVSE for visual identification.

children.name: parking_restrictions
children.description: Restrictions that apply to a parking spot.

children.name: EV_ONLY
children.description: Reserved parking spot for electric vehicles.

children.name: PLUGGED
children.description: Parking is only allowed while plugged in (charging).

children.name: DISABLED
children.description: Reserved parking spot for disabled people with valid ID.

children.name: CUSTOMERS
children.description: Parking spot for customers/guests only, for example in case of a hotel or shop.

children.name: MOTORCYCLES
children.description: Parking spot only suitable for (electric) motorcycles or scooters.

children.name: images
children.description: Links to images related to an EVSE such as photos or logos.

children.name: url
children.description: URL from where the image data can be fetched through a web browser.

children.name: thumbnail
children.description: URL from where a thumbnail of the image can be fetched through a webbrowser.

children.name: category
children.description: Category of an image

children.name: CHARGER
children.description: Photo of the physical device that contains one or more EVSEs.

children.name: ENTRANCE
children.description: Location entrance photo. Should show the car entrance to the location from street side.

children.name: LOCATION
children.description: Location overview photo.

children.name: NETWORK
children.description: Logo of an associated roaming network to be displayed with the EVSE for example in lists, maps and detailed information views.

children.name: OPERATOR
children.description: Logo of the charge point operator, for example a municipality, to be displayed in the EVSEs detailed information view or in lists and maps, if no network logo is present.

children.name: OTHER
children.description: Other

children.name: OWNER
children.description: Logo of the charge point owner, for example a local store, to be displayed in the EVSEs detailed information view.

children.name: type
children.description: Image type: gif, jpeg, png, svg

children.name: width
children.description: Width of the full scale image

children.name: height
children.description: Height of the full scale image

children.name: last_updated
children.description: Timestamp when this EVSE or one of its Connectors was last updated (or created).

children.name: parking_cost
children.description: Indicates if parking is free or paid.

children.name: free
children.description: Parking is free

children.name: paid
children.description: Parking includes a fee

children.name: properties
children.description: Optional object where you can store custom data you need in your application. This extends the current functionalities we offer

fields.name: directions
fields.description: Human-readable directions on how to reach a station

children.name: language
children.description: Language Code ISO 639-1

children.name: text
children.description: Text to be displayed to an end user. No markup, html etc. allowed.

fields.name: operator
fields.description: Information about an operator

children.name: id
children.description: Unique operator ID

children.name: external_id
children.description: External ID of an operator provided by the operator data source

children.name: name
children.description: Name of an operator

children.name: website
children.description: Link to an operator’s website

children.name: logo
children.description: Image link to an operator’s logo

children.name: url
children.description: URL from where the image data can be fetched through a web browser.

children.name: thumbnail

fields.name: facilities
fields.description: Facilities a charging station belongs to

children.name: HOTEL
children.description: A hotel.

children.name: RESTAURANT
children.description: A restaurant.

children.name: CAFE
children.description: A cafe.

children.name: MALL
children.description: A mall or shopping center.

children.name: SUPERMARKET
children.description: A supermarket.

children.name: SPORT
children.description: Sport facilities: gym, field etc.

children.name: RECREATION_AREA
children.description: A recreation area.

children.name: NATURE
children.description: Located in, or close to, a park, nature reserve etc.

children.name: MUSEUM
children.description: A museum.

children.name: BIKE_SHARING
children.description: A bike/e-bike/e-scooter sharing location.

children.name: BUS_STOP
children.description: A bus stop.

children.name: TAXI_STAND
children.description: A taxi stand.

children.name: TRAM_STOP
children.description: A tram stop/station.

children.name: METRO_STATION
children.description: A metro station.

children.name: TRAIN_STATION
children.description: A train station.

children.name: AIRPORT
children.description: An airport.

children.name: PARKING_LOT
children.description: A parking lot.

children.name: CARPOOL_PARKING
children.description: A carpool parking.

children.name: FUEL_STATION
children.description: A Fuel station.

children.name: WIFI
children.description: Wifi or other type of internet available.

fields.name: time_zone
fields.description: Value from the IANA time zone database representing the time zone of a location. Examples: "Europe/Oslo", "Europe/Zurich". (http://www.iana.org/time-zones)

fields.name: opening_times
fields.description: Times when an EVSEs at a location can be accessed for charging

children.name: twentyfourseven
children.description: True to represent 24 hours a day and 7 days a week, except the given exceptions.

children.name: regular_hours
children.description: Regular hours, weekday-based. Only to be used if twentyfourseven=false, then this field needs to contain at least one RegularHours object.

children.name: weekday
children.description: Number of days in the week, from Monday (1) till Sunday (7)

children.name: period_begin
children.description: Begin of the regular period, in local time, given in hours and minutes. Must be in 24h format with leading zeros. Example: "18:15". Hour/Minute separator: ":" Regex: ([0-1][0-9]|2[1-3]):[0-5][0-9].

children.name: period_end
children.description: End of the regular period, in local time, syntax as for period_begin. Must be later than period_begin.

children.name: exceptional_openings
children.description: Exceptions for specified calendar dates, time-range based. Periods the station is operating/accessible. Additional to regular_hours. May overlap regular rules.

children.name: period_begin
children.description: Begin of the exception. In UTC, time_zone field can be used to convert to local time.

children.name: period_end
children.description: End of the exception. In UTC, time_zone field can be used to convert to local time.

children.name: exceptional_closings
children.description: Exceptions for specified calendar dates, time-range based. Periods the station is not operating/accessible. Overwriting regular_hours and exceptional_openings. Should not overlap exceptional_openings.

children.name: period_begin
children.description: Begin of the exception. In UTC, time_zone field can be used to convert to local time.

children.name: period_end
children.description: End of the exception. In UTC, time_zone field can be used to convert to local time.

fields.name: charging_when_closed
fields.description: Indicates if the EVSEs are still charging outside the opening hours. E.g. when a parking garage closes its barriers over night, is it allowed to charge till the next morning? Default: true

fields.name: images
fields.description: Links to images related to a location such as photos or logos

children.name: url
children.description: URL from where the image data can be fetched through a web browser.

children.name: thumbnail
children.description: URL from where a thumbnail of the image can be fetched through a webbrowser.

children.name: width

fields.name: energy_mix
fields.description: Details of the energy supplied at a location

children.name: is_green_energy
children.description: True if the power is 100% from regenerative sources

children.name: energy_sources
children.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of energy sources of this location’s tariff.

children.name: source
children.description: The type of energy source.

children.name: NUCLEAR
children.description: Nuclear power sources.

children.name: GENERAL_FOSSIL
children.description: All kinds of fossil power sources.

children.name: COAL
children.description: Fossil power from coal.

children.name: GAS
children.description: Fossil power from gas.

children.name: GENERAL_GREEN
children.description: All kinds of regenerative power sources.

children.name: SOLAR
children.description: Regenerative power from PV.

children.name: WIND
children.description: Regenerative power from wind turbines.

children.name: WATER
children.description: Regenerative power from water turbines.

children.name: percentage
children.description: Percentage of this source (0-100) in the mix.

children.name: environ_impact
children.description: Key-value pairs (enum + percentage) of nuclear waste and CO2 exhaust of this location’s tariff.

children.name: category
children.description: The environmental impact category of this value.

children.name: NUCLEAR_WASTE
children.description: Produced nuclear waste in grams per kilowatthour.

children.name: CARBON_DIOXIDE
children.description: Exhausted carbon dioxide in grams per kilowatthour.

children.name: amount
children.description: Amount of this portion in g/kWh.

children.name: supplier_name
children.description: Name of the energy supplier, delivering the energy for this location or tariff.*

children.name: energy_product_name
children.description: Name of the energy suppliers product/tariff plan used at this location.*

fields.name: last_updated
fields.description: Timestamp when a location, or one of its EVSEs or Connectors were last updated (or created)

fields.name: external_id
fields.description: ID provided by a station data source

fields.name: location
fields.description: GeoJSON location of a charging station

children.name: type
children.description: Point type

children.name: coordinates
children.description: The coordinates array with longitude as first value and latitude as second one

fields.name: elevation
fields.description: Elevation (altitude) level

fields.name: chargers
fields.description: Groups of EVSEs by power and type

children.name: standard
children.description: Type of charger

children.name: CHADEMO
children.description: The connector type is CHAdeMO, DC

children.name: DOMESTIC_A
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "A", NEMA 1-15, 2 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_B
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "B", NEMA 5-15, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_C
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "C", CEE 7/17, 2 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_D
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "D", 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_E
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "E", CEE 7/5 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_F
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "F", CEE 7/4, Schuko, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_G
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "G", BS 1363, Commonwealth, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_H
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "H", SI-32, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_I
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "I", AS 3112, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_J
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "J", SEV 1011, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_K
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "K", DS 60884-2-D1, 3 pins

children.name: DOMESTIC_L
children.description: Standard/Domestic household, type "L", CEI 23-16-VII, 3 pins

children.name: IEC_60309_2_single_16
children.description: IEC 60309-2 Industrial Connector single phase 16 amperes (usually blue)

children.name: IEC_60309_2_three_16
children.description: IEC 60309-2 Industrial Connector three phase 16 amperes (usually red)

children.name: IEC_60309_2_three_32
children.description: IEC 60309-2 Industrial Connector three phase 32 amperes (usually red)

children.name: IEC_60309_2_three_64
children.description: IEC 60309-2 Industrial Connector three phase 64 amperes (usually red)

children.name: IEC_62196_T1
children.description: IEC 62196 Type 1 "SAE J1772"

children.name: IEC_62196_T1_COMBO
children.description: Combo Type 1 based, DC

children.name: IEC_62196_T2
children.description: IEC 62196 Type 2 "Mennekes"

children.name: IEC_62196_T2_COMBO
children.description: Combo Type 2 based, DC

children.name: IEC_62196_T3A
children.description: IEC 62196 Type 3A

children.name: IEC_62196_T3C
children.description: IEC 62196 Type 3C "Scame"

children.name: PANTOGRAPH_BOTTOM_UP
children.description: On-board Bottom-up-Pantograph typically for bus charging

children.name: PANTOGRAPH_TOP_DOWN
children.description: Off-board Top-down-Pantograph typically for bus charging

children.name: TESLA_R
children.description: Tesla Connector "Roadster"-type (round, 4 pins)

children.name: TESLA_S
children.description: Tesla Connector "Model-S"-type (oval, 5 pins)

children.description: Power of a charger

children.description: Price of a charger

children.description: Charging speed

children.name: continent

children.name: street

children.name: number
children.description: Street number

children.name: postalCode
children.description: Postal code of a location

children.name: what3Words
children.description: String composed of 3 words which represent the location of an address on the globe. More details: http://w3w.co/<what3Words>

children.name: formattedAddress
children.description: Human-readable address of a location

fields.name: properties
fields.description: Optional object where you can store custom data you need in your application. This extends the current functionalities we offer

fields.name: realtime
fields.description: A flag which indicates if a station has realtime information about the availability of its connectors

fields.name: private
fields.description: A flag which indicates if a station is on a private property

fields.name: power
fields.description: Connectors grouped by power

fields.name: predicted_availability
fields.description: Station availability

children.name: weekday
children.description: Number of weekday from 1 (monday) to 7 (sunday)

children.name: prediction
children.description: The prediction for each hour 0-23 from 1 to 5 (1 - very busy ... 5 very quiet (free))

fields.name: speed
fields.description: Charging speed for a station

children.name: slow

children.name: fast
children.description: Fast charging stations (above 43 kWh and below 150 kWh)

children.description: Ultra fast charging stations (above 150 kWh)
